K.P. JYYOTHINDRANATH, J.
Dated this the 27" day of December, 2016
ORDER
1.This is a petition filed by the 2"? accused in Crime
No.1092/2016 of Palakkad Town South Police Station.
The offence alleged is under Section 20(b)(ii)(B) of
Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985.
The quantum of ganja involved is 10 kg.
2.When default bail was granted by the lower court, a
condition was imposed that one of the sureties must be
one of his parents with landed properties. The
petitioner is aggrieved by the said condition.
3.It is submitted by the learned counsel for the petitioner
that the court below cannot suppose that the parents of
the petitioner are having landed properties. I see force
in the said submission.
4.Similarly, the petitioner is also aggrieved by the
condition that the original title deed of the properties

Pal
2016/KER/55578

Crl.M.C. No. 9087 of 2016
also should be produced by the sureties, not for
perusal, but, has to be deposited. The petitioner is also
aggrieved by the condition to deposit %1,00,000/-
(Rupees one lakh only) before the court below as cash
security while executing bond.

5.Heard the learned Public Prosecutor as well.

6.After hearing the learned Public Prosecutor, I feel that
the condition that one among the sureties shall be one
of his parents with landed properties has to be
interfered with.

7.The petitioner is aged 36 years and it is submitted that
his father is no more. After considering all these
aspects, the second condition imposed by the court
below while granting bail in Crl.M.P. No.3642/2016 in
Crime No.1092/2016 of Palakkad Town South Police
Station is hereby deleted. The third condition imposed
is modified to the extent that after perusal of the title
deeds by the court below, the said title deeds can be
returned on an undertaking to produce the same as and
